intro: Noccaea amani, commonly known as the Amanian honesty, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other well-known plants such as cabbages and mustards. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale pink flowers and hairy, lobed leaves. It typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to cold, alpine environments. Noccaea amani is often found in high-altitude meadows and is a relatively rare species.
